div.bibl: L'Italia, September 16, 1917A PROTEST OF CONSUL COUNT BOLOGNES! AND THE INVENTION OF NANNI

body.p: The Italian Consul Count Bolognesi has written to L'Italia, protesting against the Ocean Safe Floating Company. He says the company takes advantage in the matter of advertising in the newspapers without authorization of a certificate which was released to Mr. Menotti Nanni, the inventor of the Ocean Safe Floating Company by Count Bolognesi Italian Consul in Chicago. Count Bolognesi says that the company tries in this manner to give the impression that he is backing the invention.
